title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:06 <vmassol> has quit  
00:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:40 <polx> has quit  
00:52 <vmassol> has quit  
01:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:52 <jvelo\_> has quit  
03:20 <crocket> vmassol, I wonder why you experience frequent ping timeouts.  
04:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:03 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:05 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
06:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <vmassol> crocket: I guess it's Mac OSX's Power Nap feature  
08:28 <vmassol> good morning  
08:28 <vmassol> the tests are failing even more than yesterday : (  
08:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <polx\_> has quit  
08:31 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <polx\_> has quit  
08:32 <polx> has quit  
08:33 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <vmassol> guys even more tests fail than yesterday :(  
08:53 <vmassol> we cannot release like this  
09:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <vmassol> trgging http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/ build manually  
09:20 <vmassol> since the error was caused by a nexus error  
09:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe you could have a look at this failing test: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-4.3/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/166/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testUninstall/  
09:21 <vmassol> there are 3 failing on master too: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/1248/  
09:22 <vmassol> nexus errors for http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/1973/console too, trigging manually too  
09:22 <vmassol> same for rest  
09:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: I see mflorea committed some fixes around pages object and integration tests maybe we need to wait a new build  
09:23 <tmortagne> yesterday  
09:23 <mflorea> platform was build for sure  
09:23 <mflorea> I don't know if all the tests were run again  
09:23 <vmassol> ok I've manually restarted the ones that failed because of nexus  
09:24 <vmassol> someone needs to look at http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/  
09:24 <vmassol> and undertand why the DM is triggered for all tests  
09:24 <vmassol> who could do this?  
09:24 <tmortagne> I'm checking  
09:24 <vmassol> ok thanks  
09:25 <vmassol> it would be great that some dev also start looking into missing translations: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/TranslationsReport43  
09:25 <vmassol> silvia made this nice report  
09:26 <vmassol> if we could kill a few ASAP that would be nice, otherwise we'll have to fix them for 4.4  
09:26 <vmassol> (or 4.3.1)  
10:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <sburjan> Hello everybody: don't forget about the IE8 blockers Manuel reported before releasing  
10:43 <mflorea> vmassol: now the browser window doesn't close for me :) I'm guessing that we need to call both close and quit..  
10:43 <vmassol> ahah  
10:43 <sburjan> tmortagne: I want to re-test XWIKI-8476 . So you say that I shouldn't be allower to install org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot / 4.3-rc-1 ?  
10:43 <mflorea> and I run the test from the console so it's not an IDE issue  
10:44 <tmortagne> sburjan: when I try to install it EM tell me it's not supported  
10:45 <tmortagne> but depends of the version you are installing  
10:45 <sburjan> ok, let me try again using the latest snapshot  
10:45 <tmortagne> org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot used to be a jar  
10:45 <tmortagne> and is now a pom  
10:45 <sburjan> I see  
10:45 <cjd> Do the ui tests run in chromium?  
10:45 <tmortagne> since it now have several sub modules  
10:45 <sburjan> so what should I install in order to have a proper instalation ? org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot-ui ?  
10:45 <cjd> err are they known to be working in chromium?  
10:45 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes  
10:46 <sburjan> tmortagne: ok. gonna play with both cases, see fi I get an "unsupported" message  
10:48 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's a bit more detailed than "unsupported", it's telling you that there is no handler for this type  
11:00 <sburjan> tmortagne: I see. It seems that simple search wants to install version 4.2 I will install it, uninstall it and try to upgrade see if it works  
11:00 <sburjan> let's see if I still have the upgrade button if I uninstall it  
11:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: when I did that it did not proposed me to upgrade it  
11:00 <tmortagne> I did not reproduced your issue  
11:01 <sburjan> yes,you told me, this is why I want to try again  
11:01 <tmortagne> I did not closed the issue because you were trying to install wrong extension  
11:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: If you reproduce the issue, make sure you don't have any error or warning during the uninstall  
11:02 <sburjan> cool, I got a stacktrace when trying to install it :(  
11:03 <sburjan> http://pastebin.com/JKWCR0pm  
11:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: well no idea what it means, it does not seems related to the install  
11:04 <sburjan> second time it worked  
11:04 <tmortagne> this error seems to be a pure jetty thing  
11:07 <sburjan> ok, installed ircbot 4.2, uninstalled ircbot 4.2, I search using advanced serach for org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot / 4.3-rc-1 and it tells me with orange that "Version 4.2 is installed" and I have a downgrade button :)  
11:07 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <sburjan> but If I search for org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot-ui, everything seems fine  
11:08 <sburjan> and I have it on Applications Panel  
11:08 <cjd> ooo netty looks pretty cool, what type of system are you running that gave you that stakc trace sburjan ?  
11:08 <sburjan> so yes, it seems that the issue kicks in only when searching for org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot  
11:09 <sburjan> cjd: http://pastebin.com/hdN7PhPZ this is what I have in my console  
11:10 <cjd> and that's just a vanilla jetty/xwiki install?  
11:10 <sburjan> yes. latest snapshot  
11:10 <sburjan> untouched. I only enabled snapshot repos from xwiki.properties. besides that it's vanilla  
11:10 <cjd> hmm, I wonder where netty is coming from.. did someone replace jetty while I was sleeping?  
11:11 <sburjan> I got these errors on yesterday's snapshot too  
11:16 <tmortagne> sburjan: I was not able to reproduce even with org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot  
11:16 <tmortagne> what distribution are you using ?  
11:17 <sburjan> so you  don't have any downgrade/upgrade button ? very odd. I'm jetty + HSQLDB -169 snapshot  
11:17 <tmortagne> no I don't, as I said in the jira issue I could not reproduce it  
11:17 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <tmortagne> will try your exact snapshot to at least reproduce it properly  
11:18 <tmortagne> 4.4 ?  
11:18 <sburjan> 4.3  
11:18 <tmortagne> ok  
11:19 <tmortagne> downloading  
11:20 <sburjan> now I am not able to reproduce it anymore, hmmm  
11:20 <sburjan> install 4.2, remove 4.2, use org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot / 4.3-rc-1  
11:23 <tmortagne> sburjan: you diid not had any error or warning in the uninstall log ?  
11:24 <tmortagne> sburjan: after you installed the extension do you go to "installed extension" or you click on uinstall right away ?  
11:25 <tmortagne> trying to do the exact same thing  
11:27 <sburjan> tmortagne: I get this error when installing 4.2 on a clean XE http://pastebin.com/0fC8tqVU  
11:28 <sburjan> but the second time I try to install it, it works  
11:28 <tmortagne> sburjan: I just reproduce the upgrade things  
11:29 <sburjan> ok, cool. now I am not the only one  
11:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <tmortagne> problem is that I can't reproduce it in debug mode...  
11:34 <sburjan> :(  
11:34 <tmortagne> will find something  
11:35 <sburjan> it's good at least you managed to reproduce it, this eliminates my paranoia :)  
11:36 <tmortagne> note that it seems to be some kind of cache issue since I can't reproduce it after a restart  
11:38 <sburjan> I managet to get the upggrade button again even if the bot is not installed anymore  
11:38 <sburjan> will try a restart see if I shows up again  
11:39 <sburjan> because anyway, pressing the upgrade button does not work  
11:40 <tmortagne> I get a lot of "NettyAsyncHttpProvider - Unexpected error on close" error in this version  
11:40 <tmortagne> don't know if we upgraded jetty or something  
11:42 <sburjan> tmortagne: yes, after a restart it seems that it's ok. I don't get the upgrade button anymore. obviously, using org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot will fail because that is a pom as you said  
11:42 <sburjan> so tehre must be something about the local repo cache  
11:50 <tmortagne> mflorea: when using advanced seach the UI calls resolve(String id, String version), right ?  
11:50 <mflorea> I think so yes  
11:51 <tmortagne> asking because it does seems to call it here  
11:51 <tmortagne> it does not stops on my breakpoint  
11:51 <tmortagne> I'm trying to understand from where the UI find that this extension is already installed  
11:52 <tmortagne> maybe getInstalledExtension() first  
11:53 <tmortagne> yep that's it, still don't understand how it can know it's a 4.2-RC-3 without asking to resolveExtension but anyway  
11:53 <tmortagne> 4.3-rc-1 sorry  
11:54 <tmortagne> ok I think I found the issue, it's indeed related to the installed extensions repository cache  
12:11 <msmeria> I've reported some blockers for IE8. Can someone please set the "fixed for" field to "4.3" ? I don't have access to that field.  
12:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <tmortagne> sburjan: should be ok now, good catch  
12:32 <sburjan> pheww.. thanks :)  
12:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: build is failing on commons  
12:43 <vmassol> guys, what do we do about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8484 ?  
12:43 <vmassol> do we consider it a blocker for 4.3?  
12:44 <vmassol> Denis: ?  
12:47 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:55 <vmassol> tmortagne/jvdrean: if i understand correctly we cannot fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8461 for 4.3 final but we'll fix it in 4.4 when mflorea introduces the question to get the current version installed, correct?  
12:56 <vmassol> OTOH could you please modify the RN for 4.3 to indicate the issue for our users if they use the DM?  
12:58 <vmassol> mflorea: is there a jira issue for this or is it directly XWIKI-8252?  
12:58 <vmassol> (this = ask the user about the current version installed)  
12:59 <mflorea> yes, it's XWIKI-8252  
12:59 <vmassol> ok, tmortagne/jvdrean, could XWIKI-8461 be considered a duplicate of XWIKI-8525?  
13:06 <vmassol> tmortagne/jvdrean: I've added it here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43#HExtensionManagerimprovements  
13:08 <vmassol> I've put http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8484 as blocker for 4.3  
13:08 <vmassol> wdyt?  
13:09 <polx> has quit  
13:10 <vmassol> tdelafosse: you need to be careful to fill all the fields when creating a jira issue  
13:10 <vmassol> specifically:  
13:10 <vmassol> - component  
13:10 <vmassol> - affected version  
13:10 <vmassol> I'm referring to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8494  
13:10 <vmassol> component = FAQ  
13:10 <vmassol> version = 4.3RC1  
13:26 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes XWIKI-8484 looks like a blocker to me  
13:32 <vmassol> now we need someone to look into it...  
13:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: for XWIKI-8461 it's a bit more complex, there is no real bug now that XWIKI-8478 is fixed. It's just that if you just click continue without looking too much at the conflict then it will keep the current XWikiPreference by default which is the situation you have when you do upgrade by hand and skip XWikiPreferences by the way so it's not worst  
13:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you verify what I've put in the RN  
13:32 <vmassol> ?  
13:32 <vmassol> (to make sure it's correct)  
13:32 <tmortagne> will check  
13:38 <Denis> vmassol: I am currently looking into XWIKI-8484...  
13:40 <vmassol> Denis: ah great, thanks :)  
13:40 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <vmassol> I'm glad you're looking into it!  
13:40 <Denis> vmassol: the problem is not in R40000XWIKI6990 as far as I understand it, it has to do with the way schema updates works, and what R43000XWIKI6691 expect to do  
13:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: thanks for your edits, could you check this last change I've jsut made?  
13:43 <vmassol> guys, i have to go out for 1 hour, bb after  
13:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: "Note that the conflict UI will wrongly indicate that there's no changes" that's not true  
13:43 <tmortagne> there is no difference  
13:44 <tmortagne> by default the UI display a diff between current version and what could be merged  
13:44 <tmortagne> if you check the diff between current version and new version you will see differences  
13:44 <vmassol> yes but that's not normal from a user pov not to see any dfiffernce  
13:44 <vmassol> when there are differences  
13:44 <vmassol> he'll just think "wtf"  
13:45 <vmassol> "why am I asked to do a merge if there are no differences"  
13:45 <vmassol> this is exactly what I thought when I saw it  
13:48 <tmortagne> that's a different issue which is more related to the fact that the UI does not indicate the conflicts and just display a diff  
13:52 <Denis> AndreasJonsson: do you confirm that what is broken is the create index EVENT\_REQUESTID happening at 9:19:41 in your log ?  
14:05 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <tdelafosse> vmassol : Ok, I have completed the JIRA issue  
14:19 <tmortagne> Enygma`: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.manager$xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/811/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_WorkspaceManager\_\_page\_CreateNewWorkspace\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ looks like a real bug in case you did not seen it  
14:19 <tmortagne> probably not much  
14:21 <Enygma`> tmortagne: looking  
14:42 <Slashman> has quit  
14:42 <Denis> vmassol: just commented the issue, I leave for lunch !  
14:42 <Denis> you get me really hungry :)  
14:45 <coud> has quit  
14:46 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <Enygma`> guys, could someone please explain to me why we return null xobjects?  
14:47 <Enygma`> there are a lot of cases when doing something like doc.getObjects(someClass) returns a list like [null, object1, object2, etc.]  
14:48 <Enygma`> I really hate having to add null checks for this sort of stuff  
14:48 <tmortagne> Enygma`: that's because the object are expected to stay at the same index in the list of objects  
14:48 <tmortagne> and I agree with you it's a pain but it's hard to get rid of this  
14:48 <Enygma`> wdym?  
14:48 <Enygma`> you mean if object has number 3 then it will appear on the index 3 in the returned list?  
14:48 <tmortagne> yes  
14:49 <Enygma`> why on earth would we want that?  
14:49 <cjd> heh so they're like file descriptors  
14:51 <Enygma`> do we have any usecase that needs this behavior?  
14:51 <tmortagne> probably not in recent code but I guess it's expected in some old code which comparing two document or things like this  
14:51 <Enygma`> (not to mention that we are also returning null lists on calls like doc.getObjects(classRef) if there are no objects of that class, which is also incredibly annoying :) )  
14:53 <vmassol> back  
14:53 <Enygma`> we should do a Null Hunting Day as well :)  
14:53 <tmortagne> Enygma`: yes and it has been fixed in the getXObjects on XWikiDocument side AFAIK  
14:53 <tmortagne> the null list  
14:54 <tmortagne> actually no  
14:54 <tmortagne> looks like it's the same  
14:55 <tmortagne> problem is that there is code doing very weird thing with those APIs and it's too late now...  
14:55 <tmortagne> will have to be more careful in new model  
14:55 <Enygma`> you mean code relying on the fact that it gets an internal reference?  
14:55 <tmortagne> yes  
14:56 <Enygma`> that`s what we get for not writing javadocs :)  
14:56 <Enygma`> ...but I see your point  
14:57 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <tmortagne> I gave up on this, I try to make sure to never change the behavior of those APIs unless there is an important security issue and I dream of the new model  
14:58 <Slashman> has quit  
15:01 <polx> has quit  
15:02 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <Slashman\_> has quit  
15:20 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <polx> has quit  
15:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <vmassol> jvelo: ping  
15:41 <vmassol> jvelo: you forgot to do this cleanup step when releasing 4.3 RC1: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HCleanupidentity  
15:41 <vmassol> specifically: "Then don't forget to https://github.com/settings/ssh."  
15:42 <vmassol> (ie remove the agent key)  
15:42 <jvelo> vmassol: ah damn it, thanks for noticing  
15:43 <jvelo> vmassol: only the remove agent key ?  
15:43 <vmassol> wel lit's easy to notice  
15:43 <vmassol> since I cannot release  
15:43 <vmassol> :)  
15:43 <jvelo> fixed  
15:43 <vmassol> github says "Key is already in use"  
15:43 <jvelo> sorry for that  
15:43 <vmassol> when I try to set it  
15:43 <vmassol> np  
15:46 <sburjan> don't forget about the IE8 blockers  
15:48 <cjd> I just dropped a big proposal on the list, I hope you guys can give it a good beating :)  I'm going to be off today for thanksgiving so I won't be able to reply until tonight or tomorrow..  
15:49 <vmassol> sburjan: which ones?  
15:50 <vmassol> cjd: happy thanksgiving!  
15:50 <vmassol> don't eat too much turkey :)  
15:50 <sburjan> vmassol: msmeria will paste the issues keys here  
15:50 <vmassol> are they set with blockers already?  
15:51 <sburjan> yes  
15:51 <cjd> thanks  
15:52 <sburjan> 6 blockers regarding IE8. They don't have a fixFor version because we don't have the rights to do so. This is why maybe you skipped them  
15:52 <vmassol> are they really blockers?  
15:52 <vmassol> let's see  
15:52 <msmeria> vmassol: XWIKI-8458 XWIKI-8460 XWIKI-8479 XWIKI-8481 XWIKI-8493 XWIKI-8485  
15:54 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=11892  
15:54 <vmassol> 12 blockers  
15:55 <vmassol> I'll remove the xoffice ones  
15:55 <vmassol> actually  
15:56 <vmassol> what we should do is remove xoffice from top level project and retire it  
15:56 <vmassol> ok I've cheated for now  
15:56 <vmassol> so that's 8 blockers  
15:57 <vmassol> I don't tink the affects is correct  
15:57 <vmassol> for ex http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8493 says 4.3RC1  
15:57 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure it's also the case in 4.2, 4.1, etc  
15:57 <vmassol> so it's not new  
15:57 <vmassol> or is it?  
15:59 <vmassol> if we want to fix those IE8 issues then we need some devs to work on them  
15:59 <vmassol> sdumitriu1: ?  
15:59 <vmassol> unless someone works on them right away it'll delay the release  
15:59 <vmassol> so we need to decide if we want that  
15:59 <vmassol> or if we want to still release and fix them in 4.3.1  
16:00 <vmassol> setting the fix for for now to not forget them  
16:01 <msmeria> testing now on 4.1.4 and 4.2 and updating the issues accordingly  
16:06 <sdumitriu1> Good morning  
16:07 <sdumitriu1> vmassol: OK, I'll check  
16:07 <vmassol> thanks sdumitriu1  
16:17 <Enygma`> vmassol:  are you starting the release now?  
16:17 <vmassol> I've started it yesterday  
16:18 <vmassol> ATM I can't do much since we have 9 blocking bugs open  
16:18 <vmassol> I'll do the translations update  
16:18 <Enygma`> I was just about to fix another issue regarding some missing translations  
16:19 <Enygma`> can you wait a bit more?  
16:19 <Enygma`> since RalucaM wanted to add the french translations  
16:23 <vmassol> Enygma`: I can wait  
16:25 <msmeria> vmassol: I've updated the issues and they don't reproduce on XE 4.1.4 but they do on 4.2  
16:26 <vmassol> ahah interesting  
16:26 <vmassol> so they should be labelled regressions  
16:27 <vmassol> cool they are  
16:27 <vmassol> :)  
16:28 <vmassol> (or you just did it ;))  
16:31 <msmeria> that was the first thing I did when I reported them :D  
16:31 <vmassol> you were lucky then :)  
16:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have a user on l10n for perfomring the translations update?  
16:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
16:34 <msmeria> lucky that sorin told me to label them, yes :P  
16:35 <vmassol> msmeria: I meant you were lucky to lavel them as regression before testing that they were regressions ;)  
16:35 <vmassol> (and in the end they were regressions!)  
16:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiTranslator  
16:36 <polx> has quit
